Name: Stiiki-World
Description:
This is "Stiiki-World" a nice, colored, sferic wolrd, "Stiiked" in one word. 
It was habitated by life-forming called "Stiiki".
The "Stiiki" was advanced up to beeing perfect creatures, amazing warriors, able archers and powerfull mages, everybodys with an unperfect genetic problem: Huge EGO.
Stiikis always been in fight, everyone think to be the best.
To exceed their limits Stiiki had learn to channel their EGO and turn it into unique skills.
Ok, we have 2 news.... the good one:
KING STIIK it was only one Stiik be able to peacekeeping and make an alleance called "Stiiki-Squad", with his huge and high-sounding EGO; this Stiiki-Squad was made-up with megalomaniac and boastful Stiiki never seen in Stiiki-World.
This Stiiki-Squad bring peace and order in all Stiiki-World.
The life expentacy of a Stiik is 30 minutes it's mean that the badly news is: 
King Stiik is just died.

YOU HAVE TO RUN!
MAKE YOUR STIIKI-SQUAD, FACE OTHER MASTER-STIIK, GAIN THE  KING-STIIK TITLE, BRING PEACE AND ORDER INTO STIIKI-WORLD!

Stiiki-World is tactical turn based game, totally sand-box for maps even for gameplay mode. 
Many playable characters with uniques skills.
Very simple to learn but hardest to master it! 
Few rules, extremely well balanced but it's tactical nature make in love pro-gamer and newbies.

—description from the designer

Name: King of Tokyo: Frantic Mutations Promo Card
Description:
New promo card for KoT/KoNY.

This promotional card for the King of Tokyo and King of New York board game is available at your friendly local game store.

Type of card: Keep
Cost: 5 energy cubes

"When you roll at least 3 punch, draw two evolution cards. Choose one to keep and discard the other."

This card requires King of Tokyo, as well as the Power Up! Expansions to be played.

Name: Zombicide (2nd Edition): Washington Z.C.
Description:
Washington Z.C. Expansion introduces for the very first time for Zombicide a story-driven campaign, full of flavorful and impactful surprises and choices, in addition to advanced rules, new characters and an iconic location.

—description from the publisher

Name: Code 3: The Hill Valley Maniac
Description: The Hill Valley Maniac is one of the first 3 expansions packs for Code 3. It includes a new officer, new chief and new scenario to play.

Name: La Garde 6mm
Description:
La Garde 6mm: Rules for Napoleonic grand tactical battles in 6mm.

The concept is to give "grand order". That is to give orders to corps & divisional commanders, not to order a single battalion.
It is considered that a divisional or brigade commander ordered to take defensive positions will form his troops in square by himself if the need was to arise ...

An original system with tokens is used to resolve combats. 
Dice are used to determine reinforcements entry times and duration of the battle.

The goal is to break the enemy morale, not just inflicting casualties.

Turn order sequence:

     Preparation phases


- Reinforcement phase
- Order phase
- Rally and officers replacement phase
- Initiative phase
- Army corps orders Disclosure


     Activation Cycle:


- Activation phase
- Orders disclosure
- Movements and combats


     Consolidation Phase


Game scale for ~6mm figures:
1cm = 20 meters.
3cm = 60 meters (width of the bases)
10cm = 200 meters (effective range of muskets)
60cm = 1200 meters (max range of 12 pounds of artillery pieces)
1m = 2km
A game turn last from 20 to 55 minutes.

- User summary

Name: David and Khanjar: Yom Kippur War in 1973
Description:
This is re-build edition of Lion of Sinai which waspublished by Kilovolt Design in 2016.

This is a war simulation game talked about Yom Kippur War in 1973 for 1 - 2 players. 
Components
A1 size board x 1
Counters x 280
Hint card x 2
Dice x 2

Name: Bloodborne: The Board Game – Blood Moon Box
Description: The Blood Moon Box was made to hold all the remaining Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goals unlocked in the campaign.

Name: Red Chicken Rising
Description:
Red Chicken Rising is a game about tactical spaceship combat in the Generic Legions universe. This game reflects the battle scenes of sci fi movies and TV shows. This is the science fiction of the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, of Red Dwarf, of Mystery Science Theater 3000, of Futurama, and of Galaxy Quest.

Red Chicken Rising is intended for use in battles involving anywhere up to a hundred ships on each side, or more. Therefore, the scope is on fleet actions, not the details of any particular ship. The mechanisms of movement and combat reflect this scope.

This game is built around the Generic Legions universe. The GL background may be left out and the game used as a generic sci fi spaceship system, or you can tack on the sci fi background of your choice.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Foodie Frenzy
Description:
Theme:
Foodie Frenzy is a fast and funny game for 3–6 players that combines dice rolling and card play. Players compete to be the first to serve the customer's order without having any LOLcats spoiling it. Success requires tactical thinking and willingness to seize opportunities, as well as quick reflexes.

Gameplay:

     Collect all the Dishes that are listed on the Order card on your Platter to win the round. 
     But it won't be that easy, though. Other players can use LOLcats cards to prevent you from delivering your meal!
     They can also spoil your Platter by placing useless cards on it!
     Be ready to grab the Kikker when the dice roll shows 2 or 3 of a kind!
     Whoever holds the Kikker gets a Bonus card for extra moves, and their Platter can’t be spoiled on that turn.


Goal:
Be the first to complete the order and cash-in the money.

—description from the designer

Name: Join the Partisans
Description:
Postani partizan (Join the Partisans) is a WW2 board game with historical background, where players join Slovenian partisans in liberating their country. Fighting against the Axis, players use dice to win in battles, answer quiz questions about WW2 and preform various tasks including singing, drawing or even bringing food for the comrades at the table.

Each player starts with a set:

     one partisan figure
     one white guard tower
     one colored guard tower (red, orange, blue, green) 


Players start the game by putting their partisan figures on a game board which represents Slovenia occupied by Axis. They choose from 130 towns and places. After they done so, they have to put white guard tower anywhere on the map. When white guard towers are set, players draft their first mission card from general headquarters beginning in 1941. The card tells them where to put their colored guard tower and what is the mission.  Players have to go through 5 years of war (1941-1945). There are 5 stacks of cards - one per year (250 missions).

Now the game begins. Players throw special dice (D3) and move towards their objective. Other players guard towers represent obstacles and can not be attacked. When a player reaches his objective from General Headquarters card, he must fulfil his/her mission. The player takes 5 battle dice. He has 3 throws to hit the best combination (scale goes from: one pair, two pairs, three of a kind,..., five of the same). After throwing his combination, the player on his right takes a role of "enemy" and tries to throw a combination with bigger value. If player fails in achieving his mission, he must wait for another turn and try again. If he wins, he receive a card from Partisan school.

The Partisan School has quiz questions about WW2. These cards bring points. After fulfilling his orders from General Headquarters players, move their white guard tower. After a successful attack (again with battle dice), a player receives a "Special Mission" card. These also bring points. Now, after both guard towers are eliminated, the player is ready to step into the next year. He again places his white guard tower on the map, and than drafts the card from year 1942 which tells him where to put his colored guard tower and what his the mission in 1942.

The player who gathers most points from Partisan School and Special Missions is the winner.
And yes.. you can get a medal!

—description from the designer

Name: Rune-atic Chambers
Description:
Runeatic Chambers is a cooperative dungeon exploration game for 1 to 2 players. Players aim to collect specific amount of Runes to proceed to the lower levels of the dungeon. If you successfully reached the deepest level, you win the game. However, if you received too much damage or too many phobias, you lose the game.

The game is composed by cards as a dungeon tile, a die for monster fights.

—description from the publisher

Name: Per My Last Email
Description:
Recommended for 4 or more players, Per My Last Email is a party game including mature content.   Easy to learn, fast to play, game length can take as little or as much time as you and your friends desire.  Play until the deck runs out, or play for a set amount of time.

We all have those things that we want to say in the email chains at work.  From avoiding confrontation with coworkers, to avoiding responsibility with the boss, Per My Last Email lets you say what you really mean.  Using Passive Aggressive and Not-So-Passive Aggressive comments, your job as a player is to avoid responsibility and rule the game.  Employee of the Month never felt so satisfying.

You start the game with each player drawing some Reply Cards.   Then one of the players is selected as the "Boss", and draws an "Email Card".   All of the other players who are not the "Boss" then respond to the Email Card with one of their Reply Cards, secretly.

â€‹The Boss then reads the Reply Cards and selects the worst excuse to assign the Email Card to.

Players take turns as the "Boss" until time is up or the deck is empty.

â€‹At the end of the game, the player who has collected the least amount of Email Cards, and has therefore avoided the most responsibility/confrontation Wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Catacombs Cubes: Monuments
Description: Adds material for the 5th and 6th players. And introduces monuments as a a new buidling type.

Name: Exploit Zero: Tsim Sha Tsui Expansion
Description:
The Tsim Sha Tsui Expansion is a supplement for Exploit Zero - Cyberpunk Espionage and Mayhem. Please note this is not a stand-alone game. You need the Exploit Zero core rules to use it.

This supplement introduces new weapons, new gear, and new threats, as well as clarifications and optional variations to the base game. It also contains a five mission mini-campaign to help players incorporate these new elements into their sessions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fish for Fish
Description:
Frantic fish-catching game Players race to collect as many fish cards as they can using suction-cup spears (hand-held, not thrown).

The fish cards come in three sizes and point values (1 for large, 2 for medium, and 3 for small).

—user summary

Name: European theater: 1941 - 1945
Description: ' European theater: 1941 - 1945' ï¼ˆå†³æˆ˜æ¬§é™†ï¼‰ is a simulation on the the land combat in Europe from 1941 to 1945. The game also has system focus on Submarine warfare, and Technology upgrading.

Name: Duck, Buck, Moose
Description:
In Duck, Buck, Moose you'll compete with up to 3 of your friends on a hunt for furry woodland creatures in this totally not-serious card game of skill, sabotage and luck. Journey into the wilderness, collecting licenses and gear and search for that prized buck (or just knock off a few rabbits). Gun jam your opponents or spook their animals to stay in the lead.

During the game players will spend 3 actions on their turn to collect Hunter or License cards, play Action cards and go on hunts in attempt to score Wildlife points; all while trying to stop others from doing the same.

As the game continues, Wildlife will be scored with new ones taking their place. When the last Wildlife card is revealed, all players will have one more full turn. At the end of the game, players add up their scored Wildlife points minus any unfulfilled Licenses. The player with the most points wins!

-description from designer

Name: Vom kleinen Maulwurf, der wissen wollte, wer ihm auf den Kopf gemacht hat. Das Spiel.
Description:
A roll-and move game about a mole that wants to find who did a dump on its head. It features the Little Mole, the butchers dog Hans-Heinerich, and other animals from the childrens book classic.

In turn, the player rolls a die and moves his pawn forward, according to the result. There are some animal spaces; landing on them provides a shortcut. Other spaces contain dog droppings; if you collect two of them, you have to skip a turn to clean your feet.

The first player who reachs the dog at the end of the track wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Double Dutch
Description:
In this game from the Netherlands, the game pieces are half-spheres in red, white, and blue – just as the national colors of our neighboring country. Each player has game pieces of one color.

The playing area consists of hexagonal spaces, each with a hollow in the middle.

Players alternate taking turns. You move one of your game pieces until you arrive at the edge of the gameboard or at a space occupied by another game piece, but the move has to be at least 2 spaces. After that, you place a new game piece, always with the flat side down.

If your move is more than 2 spaces, you turn the game piece over after your move so that it is now lying in the hollow with the round side down. This means that this game piece is fixed on this space and may no longer be moved.

With every turn, there are more and more game pieces on the board, which leaves fewer free spaces and therefore fewer moving possibilities.

Having to skip a turn does not necessarily mean that you have no chance of moving any more.
Who will make the very last move and thus win the game?

—description from the publisher

Name: Bloqueo
Description:
In Bloqueo, a turn always consists of three steps:


     Move a game figure at least two spaces,
     Place one of your octagons, and
     Put two blocking pieces on this octagon.


Turn after turn, more and more spaces are occupied with octagonal pieces. In the best case, you connect these spaces into groups – provided that the spaces are orthogonally adjacent. If you even manage to have a high tower as part of a large group, you can definitely score many points.

These towers may grow up to four levels; at the scoring, they serve as a multiplier. The color of the octagon on top determines who scores for this tower.

It can be difficult at times to decide which game figure to move, which of your octagons to protect, and which tower to conquer, but these decisions make the game interesting and demanding.

—description from the publisher

Name: Más mascotas
Description:
Mas macscotas is an expansion for the hilarious game Mascotas. In this expansion (requires the original game to play) you will find two more pets to take care of, your babies, as well as new characters and a new way of playing.

You will also find a large card that will allow you to customize the game with your own pet !!!

Name: Telepathic
Description:
A cooperative game of wordless communication
You and your partner must arrange the colored symbols so you both win. But neither of you knows what the other needs! Your only communication is a card that can mean four different things. You must read your partner’s mind to understand what they want. If you misread them, you will both lose. To win you must both be Telepathic!

Gameplay
Telepathic is a cooperative two-player game in which you must communicate without speaking or gesturing. You and your partner each have one secret win condition and one secret lose condition. You must arrange a grid of tiles so that it simultaneously matches both partners’ win conditions. When you believe you have done so, you must each announce each other’s win condition. You lose if either of you announce the wrong win condition, or if the grid ever matches either partner’s lose condition.

The rulebook also includes rules for a 3+ player mode, a 4 player mode, and 2v2 team competitive play.

(text from the game's online description from The Game Crafter)

Name: Scarty
Description:
Scarty is a card game on the world of waste and, in particular, on that of recycling. The game (for 2-8 players) has simple rules, is also suitable for children (ages 6 and up) and includes a strategy aimed not only at acquiring personal points but also at blocking the game of the opponents. The aim of the game is to discard all the cards first, that is, to remain without cards in hand.
The cards can be discarded by putting each waste in the right dumpster but only if the right dumpster has been put on the table before. There are also some waste cards that can pollute and block a dumpster. In that case, only cards with a 4R (Recycle) process can unblock pollute dumpsters. Some special waste can seriously pollute the environment so that if played they will penalize the player by forcing him to draft three more cards from the deck; as an additional effect, all players should pass a card to the relative player on their left.

Name: Zulu: Rules for Miniatures
Description:
Updated and Replaced by "Zulu Skirmish" in December 2020 - Click the "Zulu Skirmish" re-implemented link in header.

Zulu Rules for Miniatures is a Regimental level table Top Game that plays like a Skirmish Game.  Use your own 28mm-15mm figures.

Zulu teaches you how to structure your British, Boers and Zulus.  It walks you through all games steps by providing you with over 45 pictures and illustrations that will assist you in learning how to build, mount and play your Zulu, Boer or British Armies.

Zulu also includes one page of Tokens and 51 “Copy and Cut”  and Cards for Leaders and Units.  You can cut them out, fold them in half and slip them into sleeves from your local game store, or simply glue stick them together on card stock.

You will also need a handful of d6 and 10 each d10 dice per Army, a measuring stick and period miniatures to play the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cirkus i stan
Description:
Each player has 4 pieces and competes to take them fasters through the cirkus. Anyone who has reached the manege in the middle first with all of their pieces wins.

The game is similar with Ludo. In ten places along the course, things happen that the player must follow, such as an extra throw.

—description from the publisher

Name: Autofahrer unterwegs
Description:
The players begin at "Start". Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the players. The first player to reach space 143 wins the game.

—user summary

Name: 13 rätt: Spelet för fotbollsälskare
Description:
The players/team roll with the dice and answering questions about football. The player or team that first gets 13 right wins. The categories are European championship/world cup, international football, Swedish football and mixed questions about football.

—description from the publisher

Name: De Vulgari Eloquentia: Upgrade Pack
Description:
The upgrade pack was originally available during the Kickstarter-campaign for those who have the first edition of the game and want to have the new contents. It includes:


     Metal coins
     Customized meeples
     The new Ritmo Bellunese expansion
     Glossario expansion (10 cards)
     Placiti di Capua expansion (12 cards)
     Poeti expansion (16 cards)
     New Cardinal Tile
     Carta Misterium Tile
     New Friar Tile
     New Papal Library Tile


—description from the publisher

Later a smaller version of it was sold as well, not containing the metal coins nor the customized meeples (but everything else from the list above).

Name: Reiseland Österreich
Description:
Each player starts at one of five starting spaces. Movement is determined by a die. The players have to visit 8 cities and return to their starting space. At each city, the player collects a colored cardboard ring to stack on his playing peace. The first player to return to his starting space with eight collected rings wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Wer sucht der findet
Description:
At the beginning of the game, different prizes are hidden in the five cardboard buildings. The players start at the park entrance. Movement is determined by a die. Some spaces are obstacles. The first player to reach a building collects the prize hidden there. When all five prizes are found, the game ends.

—user summary

Name: Talenticity
Description:
Talenticity - The Art-Battle with Visual Magic!
A competitive tactical 2-4 players board game in which players compete for territory, make Moneye (the official currency of Talenticity), collect artifacts and become the superstar!

Talenticity is a mix of a strategy and tactical board game. Explore the Talenticity field with your hero, perform, run shows and conquer the city. And meanwhile: watch out for other artists, they want this city too!

The game starts with random hero and god cards distribution, each player picks a faced down card of a hero and a god.

The players receive their Hero miniatures and their performance miniatures.

Each player rolls the dices, the one with the biggest outcome starts the game. Then the order goes in a clockwise direction.

At the beginning of every day, all players take a piece of the Skies in order and use their God's eye to see the hidden image. The first player to take a piece of the Skies changes in a clockwise direction every new day. The Players should take and put the skies back one by one in a clockwise direction as well. Each player puts the Skies part back anywhere they want and tries to remember that location.

It is possible to compete in the sky too! Players can follow who saw which sky and take it to change its position on the next day.

Players' Turn:

The player takes a show card from the deck at the start of his/her turn. Each player can have only 3 show cards in hand. Each turn player can take a show card from the deck or put one show card back under the deck of shows.

The player rolls the dices and uses the Action Points*:

1 AP for movement on the board
2 AP to place a performance mini around the hero miniatures
3 AP to perform a show. 
4 AP to knock out another players performance miniature

     - The Players do not have to use all the action points that they have every turn.


The players can offer to trade or sell shows and artifact cards to other players during their turn.

To perform a show, the player has to have 3 performance miniatures around the picked location. Then the player has to show the other players the piece of the skies that gives the blessing to perform a show in this location. If the player fails to show the correct sky piece, the show is canceled. The player takes back all three performance miniatures around that location and receives no Moneye. If the show is successful, then the player receives that location card + Moneye according to the show card + any combos.

For placing a performance miniature on the playing field, the player earns 1 Moneye.

The player doubles double the Moneye earned from a show that matches the player's god.

The player gets +2 extra Moneye if he or she performs the show in a matching location.

After performing a show, if unused action points remain, the player can use them.

To receive an artifact the player must show a combination of 3 Moneye that read the artifact name.

It is not allowed to combo artifacts in one turn. Each artifact can only be used once in the game.

The game ends when one of the players performs 5 shows (6 shows for 2&3 players).

The richest player wins the Art-Battle!

Name: Tonga Blocks
Description:
Tonga Blocks is a tower building dexterity game where the player who causes the tower to fall loses.

The rule book also contains 30+2 different puzzles that can be built using the blocks of the game.

When playing TONGA Blocks, it is a good idea to agree on the rules in advance. There are many ways to play TONGA - Serene or fiery Argentinian, are you building a solid or easily falling tower, with two hands or weaker hand, can you continue the game by taking the lower pieces already laid... The pieces also go for random construction and imaginative play.

Tonga Blocks comes in a cardboard box, but the pieces are meant to be stored in the fabric bag provided.

—user summary

Name: To Ur is Human: Pre-biblical Warfare in the City-States of Mesopotamia
Description:
To Ur is Human is a set of table top rules written specifically for games set in the period of the Mesopotamian city-states, such as Akkad and Ur. Using a gridded playing area and easy to learn innovative rules, To Ur is Human allows for quick play games with a unique feel and approach. The author is a historian, wargamer and blogger who has written several sets of wargames rules and games, some of which were published by the Society of Ancients as re-subscription incentive games, when there was such a thing.

—description from the designer
Families: History: Wars in the Ancient Near East

Name: Node
Description:
Node is a competitive strategy game where players compete to quickly build the best node network. A series of square cards are shuffled and laid out to form the game board, and players then place nodes on the corners, and branches on the edges of the squares.

Every node a player places on the board grants them additional resources, which can then be used to buy additional nodes and branches to further expand their network. Things quickly become tricky though, as the squares on the board can become exhausted and stop granting resources, or captured by a player.

Players accumulate points by placing nodes, capturing squares, and having the largest network, first to 10 points wins. Experienced players may also play the advanced ruleset, which is even more challenging!

—description from the publisher

Name: Boxkampf-Spiel
Description:
The boxing match goes about three rounds. The players start on space 1 (center space) ant try to reach space 100. Movement is determined by a die. If a player lands on a picture, he gets points, other benefits or penalties. If a player gets on space 100 he wins the game by knocking out his opponent. Otherwise the player with the most points wins after three rounds.

—user summary

Name: 76 Hours of Hell: The Invasion of Tarawa, Nov 43
Description:
"76 Hours of Hell" (76HOH) is a two-player wargame simulation that depicts the November 1943 American invasion of the Tarawa Atoll. This was the first major amphibious invasion launched in the Pacific against an entrenched enemy. 76 HOH is much more of a game than a simulation, and was developed in the spirit of the popular Avalon Hill Panzerblitz game that spawned so many variants in the 1970’s. As such, the rules are “design for effect” in an attempt to keep their length and scope to a manageable level, allowing players to fight the battle, not the rules.

In the rules, historical notes and explanations are listed in italics. Now, hit the beach!

Components: 33 x 17 map, 2 counter sheets, 18 page rule book with charts, scenarios and notes. The map layout is offered in two sizes, tabloid or letter, for the convenience of PNP.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Zeti Toto Spiel
Description:
The players may bet on the results of the toto-device in the following games:


     Sport-Toto
     Gesellschafts-Toto
     Farben- und Zahlenspiel


The bets are placed on the inner game board.

The toto-device can also be used like a die to play the "Wettrennspiel" (Race Game) on the outer track of the game board. The first player to reach space "Ziel" wins the game.

The toto-device contains a variable number of white, red and black marbles, depending on the game played. There are up to 19 white, 8 black and 7 red marbles. By shaking the device in a upside down position and then turn it up, the marbles fall into the slot and each marble indicates a number.

On the back of the game board, there is a "Nine Men's Morris" game.

—user summary

Name: Kami-sama: Ichijama Promo
Description:
4 promo cards included (1 for each season deck) as part of Dice Tower's 2019 Kickstarter campaign

When drawn "Each player must swap the positions of their Favor and Nature tracks. If a player has the same amount of Favor and Nature, they must lose either 2 Favor or 2 Nature."

Name: Elf Locksmith
Description:
In Elf's world, all locks have a magical reset diamonds inside the lock, which could only be used by locksmith. 
During the game, players will play as Elf Locksmiths, use the magic keys in hands, through all the lock cogs and keyholes inside, to reset the lock, and save the poor Elf Sibbings the day!

The game's rundown is simple:

     Setup the Locks according to instructions;
     Put the magic key into the keyholes, and find a way to reach the reset diamonds, without destroying the lock.
     Whoever reset the lock save the day!

Name: Roll It!
Description:
The Animals's Carnival is here! Every year they team up and  rock & roll their city! The most important thing is that you need to put your ball into the center hole as the best blessing team!
During the game, players needs to put their team's animals on different sides of the city, spin the city plate, and try to roll their ball more close to the center hole. 
Let's rock and roll!

Name: WereABC
Description:
Werewolf's world is big, full of fabulous creatures and characters! Once up a time, they got together and organized a game night called "BINGO!"
The game is simple:

     Play as many cards as you want, as long as they can form up a formation;
     And the next player should play cards following the last player's formation;
     The last player who plays the formation wins the current round, and take all B, I, N, G, O cards among the played cards this round.
     If there is a player played out his hand cards, the game night is over, and everyone calculate their five score cards: B,I,N,G,O. 


5. The player who has the most B,I,N,G,O cards wins the game!

Name: City of Gears: Gear-Driven Puppeteer Promo Tile
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Promo tile for City of Gears.

Gain 1 point for each adjacent tile containing an opponent's robot.

—user summary

Name: Code 3: The Breaking Point
Description: The Breaking Point is one of the first three expansions packs for Code 3. It includes a new officer, new chief and new scenario to play.

Name: Code 3: The Corrupt Mayor
Description: The Corrupt Mayor is one of the first 3 expansions packs for Code 3. It includes a new officer, new chief and new scenario to play.

Name: Accuse Me?!
Description:
You are a citizen of the small town, Suemlots, and the mayor is in big trouble.  As the most litigious person in the most litigious city in the most litigious state in the country, he has to keep his dirty dealings under wraps.  The mayor needs distractions and has told the top eight attorneys in his beautiful city to take any case they can get so that he can get the heat off of him.

WE cards provide or block evidence to back up or refute an accusation. For example, a “Security Video Footage” may be used to add a Point to the accuser’s case, but the defender may cancel that card out with a “Blurry Video” WE card. To win a case, the accuser must beat the defense by three points.

With hints from the Crime and Clue cards, players now have the option to Accuse each other of a crime listed in the Suemlots Gazette. Players then try to build a case and take it to court. In court, the prosecution (accuser) always goes first. Randomly turn over a Judge card. Apply Attorney and Judge bonuses or negatives to the case. Explain your case by laying down applicable WE cards and attempt to sway the judge and jury with your witnesses and evidence.

After the prosecution has laid their case before the judge, the defense now brings their evidence and witnesses to bear. All cards to be played by the defense now come into play and a preponderance of evidence/witnesses will win the day. To use the sample from above, a “Security Video Footage” may be used to add a point to the accuser’s case, but the defender may cancel that card out with a “Blurry Video” WE card.

The Accuser wins the case when they have three or more uncontested pieces of evidence/witnesses that the defense is unable to deflect, block, or have thrown out of court.  The Defense wins in any condition where the prosecution team has less than three pieces of evidence that are uncontested. The game ends when an accuser wins their case in court.

—description from the designer

Name: Star Wars: Destiny – Covert Missions Booster Pack
Description:
The galaxy can change in a single instant. The destruction of Alderaan announced to the galaxy that the dreaded Death Star was fully operational. In the same way the Rebel’s swift destruction of the Death Star brought a spark of hope to the galaxy and signaled a changing tide. These covert missions are undertaken by some of the most iconic character’s in the galaxy, and can change the balance of the Force.

Undertake top-secret plans with Covert Missions, a 160-card booster set for Star Wars: Destiny!

Covert Missions expands on the themes of the Convergence Block by continuing to place an emphasis on sub-types, downgrades, and plots! In this set, look for a new keyword, iconic characters, and two new plots that provide an alternate victory condition.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aristeia!: Advanced Tactics Decks
Description:
This blister contains two new General-type decks, both with numbered tactics from #009 to #018, in the indicated language.

Starting with Season 3 of the AGL, players will be able to form their Tactics Decks in each round of a  tournament by replacing the core box General Tactics with TComm Deck Tactics or Sterling Forge Deck Tactics.

TComm offers tools for managing the Tactics Deck, the player's own hand, and even the possibility to affect the hand of their opponent. Sterling Forge gives the player the ability to improve the stats of their rolls
—description of the publisher (translated)

Este blíster contiene dos nuevos mazos de tipo General, ambos con Tácticas numeradas del #009 al #018, en el idioma indicado.

A partir de la Temporada 3 de la AGL, los jugadores podrán formar sus Mazos de Tácticas en cada ronda de torneo pudiendo sustituir las Tácticas de tipo General de la Caja Básica por las Tácticas del mazo TComm o las del mazo Sterling Forge.
—description of the publisher

Name: BIZLIVE!
Description:
BIZLIVE! is a card-driven business strategy game themed around alternative satirical news and large global companies. An economic simulation game, it forces negotiations between players and the pursuit of aggressive strategies in the face of constant challenges from news events.

It gamifies several core economic concepts such as cash and capital, cash flow management, supply and demand, auction (for companies and executive team members), valuation of companies, acquisitions and divestment, synergies, business risks and opportunities, and return on investment and return on equity. Additionally, it alerts players to the importance of news and alternative news in constructing the reality that impacts companies.

Four Chairmen fight for control over 24 companies and 20 executive team members, while navigating 141 satirical news events that create risks and opportunities for companies. The Chairman with most company value and positive cashflow created during the four quarters of the game wins. The best chairmen increase the initial sum of 30 Merx (for Mercurius) to more than 100 Merx during the game.

BizLive!’s purpose is to mimic real life’s never-ending struggle between fate, luck, chance on the one hand, and conscious, rational, strategic management decisions on the other hand.

—description from the designer

Name: Villagers: Promo Pack 1
Description:
Two copies each of two new Solitary villagers, both featuring silver scoring, which pay out in the final market phase. The pack also includes a double-sided player aid card for the solo mode.

The new villagers are playable at all player counts, including solo, and should be shuffled into the main deck before setup. They are:

Scribe
Score 1 gold for every card you have in hand.

Plower
Score 2 gold for each grain symbol in your village.

Name: D100 Dungeon: Mapping Game
Description:
The D100 Dungeon - Mapping Game, combines the rule book with cards and tokens to give the game a board game feel. It includes 96 mapping cards, 24 map overlay cards, 53 monster cards, and 150 tokens. By using the Mapping Game, you will get to create the  dungeon your exploring on the table in front of you instead of drawing it on a Dungeon Sheet. The Mapping Game is compatible with all other D100 Dungeon Products. You will need the original Version 3 Rule book in order to use this game.

—description from the designer

Name: Draw West
Description:
Draw West is a micro card game with bag building. The game plays several rounds, until the end game condition is met.

During player turn, the player:

     Either plays a face up card from his/ her hand to perform the ability on the card, 
     Or plays a face down card to perform one of Market actions. 


When each player plays six cards in their tableau, the round ends. Then the players determines their faction by the number of the face up cards in their tableau. If there are two factions in the end of the round, the final duel carries out. The player from each faction starts to duel by drawing cubes from their bags until there is only one faction survived and the survived players scores.

—description from the designer

Name: Crazier Eights: Omniscience promo card
Description:
A card to incorporate into a version of Crazier Eights.

Card Text:
At the beginning of your turn, you draw five cards. Then you may discard six additional cards this turn.

Name: Pro Roma!
Description:
“Rome don't pay traitors”  (puts them to rule)

Pro Roma! is  a strategy and management game in which players put themselves in the shoes of Rome senators with the goal to obtain power through their management to lead their faction to the hegemony .

To do this, first  they must fight in the Senate to obtain Charges and be able to take control of the different areas of the city management: They must be efficient enough to be recognized by the people, making the City prosper and defending it from incursions. and dangers from its borders.

There are three phases: Election, Management and Event.
In the first phase players take resource cards and they must decide which card must be used to obtain votes, votes that later will be decisive to obtain Charges through a hidden betting mechanism, Charges like the Consul, the Edil or the Tribune. The game compensates those who obtain less relevant Charges giving them more possibilities to opt to better Charges.

In the second phase players will be able to perform the actions assigned to their Charges in a established order. For which they will have the resource cards that remain in their hand. The goal is to put their counters every time he can do a successfully action.

In the last phase maybe Rome must face a raid, for which the military investment that the players have made so far can be decisive for the victory.

The game will ends when a player uses all its counters, being declared the winner. On the other hand, an automatic victory is also possible if a player must use a counter when he doesn't have  any counter in his reserve.

—description from the publisher

Name: Call the Midwife
Description:
Be part of the popular drama Call the Midwife, by helping Women all over Poplar as they go into labour! The Midwives of Nonnatus House have never been so busy, delivering babies in all sorts of locations! Will you get to your next delivery on time or will you be required to divert to the Surgery to assist Dr Turner? Try not to get a bicycle puncture or forget your delivery pack as you might be delivering twins or even triplets! Using easy to learn gameplay, roll the dice, collect cards and delivers babies!! The Midwife to deliver the most babies wins the game! The Call the Midwife Boardgame has been developed by Rachel Lowe and faithfully follows the drama of the award winning TV Show.

—description from the designer

Name: Six Empires
Description:
Six Empires is a historical strategy game with unique mechanics for world events, national morale, and non-player nations.

Each territory in the game is assigned a point value. Higher value territories give you more points, but are harder to conquer!

In addition, some territories have additional benefits like the ability to generate new military units or a port city that will benefit your economy. (But also make you more vulnerable to attack!)

The goal is to reach 30 total points worth of territories that you control, while controlling all the territories of your color, and at least one territory of another player's color.

—description from the designer

Name: Mystic Vale: Nemesis
Description:
Mystic Vale: Nemesis adds new advancement and vale cards to the base Mystic Vale game, giving players more card-crafting options and exciting new possibilities for combos. Leader cards in the form of titans grant abilities that can be upgraded to become even more powerful!

Curse tokens offer players a quicker path to power, but with a price at the end of the game. Nemesis cards introduce an exciting new variant for a solitaire game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tail Story
Description:
Tail Story is a reverse deck building game: build your deck using other player's discard pile and force your unused cards to them!

Each player takes the role of a pet from 1 of the 3 types: CANINE, FELINE or RODENT & FRIENDS.
to collect achievements to win the game!

The players take turns and do whatever it takes to draw the cards from their own deck as fast as they can to complete 4 achievements to win the game!

Each player is dealt 15 EVENT CARDS to make his/her own deck at the start of the game. Every time a player runs out of cards in his/her deck, the player shuffles all the cards in his/her discard pile to make a deck again. He/she then chooses 1 card from his/her hand and puts it face-down in front of him/her. This is called AN ACHIEVEMENT. The player who gets the 4th ACHIEVEMENT first is considered the winner!

—description from the designer

Name: Parrot Pair-it
Description:
Parrot Pair-it is a cute and easy game that people of any age can enjoy. Each deck contains beautiful artwork of 26 pairs of parrots. Each pair has its own point value based on how common the parrot species is.

There are two ways to play Parrot Pair-it:

Dexterity

For those who want a dexterity-based game, five random cards would be spread on the table, face up. Each player draws seven cards from the rest of the deck. The player whose turn it is looks for a pair. If there is on in their hand, easy points, lay them down in front of you. If they have a card in their hand that matches a card the table, they must let the parrot fly down to its mate. Hold the card at least a foot above the table, flip it up and try to get it to land, face up, touching its match. If it does, pick up it and add it to your collected pairs. If not, place it in the discard pile, draw a card, and hope you’ll do better the next try.

Simply Picking Pairs

Another way to play Parrot Pair-it is the Old Maid method, where players hold a hand of seven cards and either ask if an opponent has a card needed to make a pair, or they may physically remove a card from an opponent’s hand. Lay any pairs down to be counted later.

Scoring

Cards have a number scale across the bottom that rises from left to right. Some parrots species will only have one pair, while others may have up to five. If a player, for example, has one pair of macaws, which is a five-pair set, it may be worth only five points. But if the player has four of the five macaw pairs, they would have 25 points, and if they have all five, fifty points. Winning the game is when one person reaches a predetermined score, or when all the parrots have been paired with the person with the highest score winning.

—description from the designer

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – M.O.D.O.K.
Description:
Marvel: Crisis Protocol – M.O.D.O.K. allows you to add one new character to the Marvel: Crisis Protocol miniatures game.

A.I.M. scientist George Tarleton had the dubious distinction of being chosen as the subject for a procedure which would transform him into a unique, bio-engineered living computer. Unable to use his limbs, Tarleton was confined to a hoverchair, which gives him both mobility and a deadly assortment of conventional weaponry. Since then, M.O.D.O.K. has used his vast intellect and exceptional psychic powers to terrorize the world as the leader of A.I.M. and one of the world’s most dangerous and unpredictable foes.

—description from the publisher

Name: UltraQuest: Gold, Ruhm! und Ehre! – Der Kobold Character Expansion / Neuer Beruf
Description:
This character expansion introduces the Kobold (new character sheet and rules).
The Kobold is among the most Agile and Intelligent of the Races.
They have some of the Skills of the Thief Character Class (even without being one) as Trade as a free skill and Pick Pocket and Duck as additional class skills.
Being small they cannot use any riding animals and hate dogs (preventing the group from having one).
Having nimble fingeres and a lot of pouches, they can carry 7 items instead of 6.
And: No Talismans for Kobolds!

Neuer Beruf für das Grundspiel, der Kobold (neuer Abenteurerbogen und Regeln für den Kobold).
Er ist unter den geschicktesten und intelligentesten Rassen.
Der Kobold besitzt schon einige Fertigkeiten des Berufs Dieb: Handeln (ohne Fertigkeitszeile) und Stehlen und Ducken als Berufsfertigkeiten.
Aufgrund ihrer Größe können sie keine Reittiere benutzen und hassen Hunde (weshalb keiner in der Gruppe sein darf).
Geschickte Finger und viele Taschen ermöglichen es dem Kobold 7 statt der üblichen 6 Gegenstände zu tragen.
Keine Talismane für den Kobold !

—user summary

Name: UltraQuest: Gold, Ruhm! und Ehre! – Lizardman Character Expansion / Echsen Abenteurer Erweiterung
Description:
This adds the Lizardman Character (Sheet and Rules) to the Base Game.
The are among the strongest and quickest races in the game, but not the brightest (reflected also in only 3 Abilities instead of the normal 4).
THe survival skills rival that of a Ranger.
New features are natural armor and armor restrictions, ice vulnerability and natural protection against heat or fire.
Some Xenophobia makes visiting dwellings harder.

Die Echsen-Erweiterung (Rasse und Regeln) für das Spiel.
Die Echse ist unter den stärksten und beweglichsten Rassen im Spiel, aber nicht die hellste (zeigt sich auch in nur 3 erlernbaren Fertigkeiten, statt der üblichen 4). 
Die steht aber mit ihren Überlebens/heimisch-Fertigkeiten mit einem Waldläufer auf einer Stufe.
Weitere Regeln sind natürlicher Schutz, Einschränkungen bei der Rüstungswahl, Kälte-empfindlichkeit und Hitzebeständigkeit.
Eine gewisse Xenophobie macht ihr das Betreten von Ansiedlungen nicht einfach.

—user summary

Name: THE GIFT OF THE GAB
Description:
THE GIFT OF THE GAB is a unique talking game that brings a combination of humour, mental stimulation and awareness. All whilst enriching speech and cognition!

Free print & play available.

Rules


     Don’t say the filler words "um", "er/uh", "like", "you know" and "basically".
     Don’t pause for more than 3 seconds.
     Don’t repeat yourself.
     Don’t talk slowly.


Overview

30 or 60 seconds to speak off the cuff...

Describe - 'Random Stuff' cards that challenge your ability to describe with your basic senses.
Discuss - 'Topical Subject' cards that challenge your ability to discuss and share knowledge on current matters.
Answer - 'Thought Provoking Question' cards that challenge your ability to answer what you may be asked in an interview, by scary in-laws and by silly friends.
Sell -'The Unsellable' cards that challenge your ability to sell by finding the value in anything.

Have you got it?

—description from the designer

Name: Čamba
Description:
A card game for 2-5 players that resembles Uno, Mau Mau, Prší, Crazy Eights. It's fast paced, full of twists and turns, with pretty illustrations and czech school environment names.
The game is played with a 32-card pack. The aim is to be first to get rid of all of one's cards. But- you can get more cards due opponent's actions, you can be even get back into the game even though you have no cards left - simply twists and turns.

Name: Nine Fields
Description:
A deck-bulding game of heroic drafts and board control.

Nine Fields is a fantasy deck-building game about drafting and board control that fits in your pocket, literally! Designed to work within the size constraints of a single mint tin, Nine Fields offers a fun, quick head-to-head strategy gaming experience that is completely self-contained and ready to go right out of the box.

Players take turns managing their resource dice to decide between purchasing cards from an ever-evolving Center Row to add to their deck, playing cards that they draw, and using those dice to power attacks against their opponents in order to eliminate them from their spaces. With 24 different base Heroes and Monsters to draft from Nine Fields offers tons of replay-ability as players explore different drafting and play strategies.

If a player can retain control of 5 spaces at the end of their opponent's turn, they win!

-description from publisher

Name: A Question of Sport: Premier
Description:
The all round sports game based on the classic TV show.
So you think your an all round sports fan? You'll need to be to win at this game of sporting knowledge.

—description from the publisher

Name: Divinities Boon: Primordium
Description:
The gods are at war with each other. But that doesn't matter to you, as you are not a god. You are a champion of your race, and your god has told you of a great relic that will provide you with immeasurable power to overcome your foes. You must gather your most fierce forces to make the journey because your enemies have the same destiny.

Divinities Boon: Primordium, pits fantasy races against each other in a battle to a magical relic. Champions command forces as they move forward on the player’s game board. Attack your opponent’s forces with melee, ranged or siege assaults to move your champion forward, or your enemy backward. Once your champion reaches the Boon, they must fight to retain control of it for three rounds. But victory is fleeting, for the other gods have the power to remove the boon and give their favored champion another chance for greatness.

Players take turns by playing one or two minions, whose MELEE, RANGED, and SIEGE stats combine. If they beat the opposing player’s minions in any of the three attacks, that champion is moved forward a number based on the cards played (attack and ranged), or the opposing champion is moved backward (siege). Champions add powerful bonuses to the minion's attacks and defenses. Boon cards may also be played to give an added edge.

Once the champion reaches the final destination, they must maintain control of the relic for three, non-consecutive rounds. The winner returns to their homeland with the favor of their god until they take it away to play their game again.

—description from the designer

Name: iKNOW: Aikamme uudet ilmiöt
Description:
In the "Special Edition" of trivia game iKNOW, you get to test what other players know while trying to score for yourself. The game includes 1,200 questions about the "new phenomenas of our time" in four categories, and each question comes with three hints at three levels of difficulty that reveal the answer piece by piece. Do you think you'll know the answer first – or should you let other players give the question a try?

iKNOW also includes a betting element that gives you a chance to win no matter how much – or how little – you know as long as you know who does or doesn't know. Do you think that your friend knows his sports forwards and backwards? Do you know that geography is your spouse's worst stumbling block? Place your bets for or against your friends, and collect the winnings.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sherlock Holmes: International
Description:
For once, Sherlock Holmes' talents are required across borders. It is with his brother Mycroft, a member of the British government, that the famous detective will go from India to the United States to solve three investigations. Play as one or the other of the Holmes brothers, and find the guilty parties.

Sherlock Holmes: International is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tuttu Juttu tuntemisleikki lisäkysymyssarja 400 uutta kysymystä
Description:
This is the 400-question version in a square box that was similar, but somewhat smaller than the original game box.

There is also a 300-question edition in a rectangular box (the same as concurrent Alias expansions); both were published in 1992.

Both versions simply have additional question decks inside the box, for the four categories of the game; no new rules or mechanics were introduced.

Name: The Game of Life: The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel Edition
Description:
Inspired by Midge Maisel's life in the Amazon Original Series, The Game of Life: The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel Edition board game has players seeking fame and fortune during 1950s New York City. Maybe you'll get married, have kids, buy a dream home, go on vacation in the Catskills, and make it as a stand-up comic. Then again, maybe you won't. You could get divorced, bomb at the jokes, and end up in a dumpy apartment. Choose a path and find out what life has in store for you. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins — unless someone hits it big time in comedy!

—description from the publisher

Name: Jenga: Fortnite
Description:
Inspired by the Fortnite video game, Jenga: Fortnite has players storming their Fortnite character up the tower, aiming to be the first one to get to the top — but if the tower falls on a player's turn, they'll crash out of the game.

Spin the spinner to find out what the next move is: how many layers to climb, and which type of blocks to stack. It's a battle to the top as players move their own pegs up and their opponents' pegs down, all while trying not to make the tower crash.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lighthouse Ahoy!
Description:
Summer, sun, sea, and a red-yellow lighthouse: Who wouldn't think of vacation?

In Lighthouse Ahoy!, each player builds their own tower, which includes the base, red and yellow disks for the tower, and the green roof. The individual components are available only with the right dice combination.

Who will have a lucky hand and get the most points?

Name: Railways of Portugal: Homage to Pombal
Description: This is a small expansion to the Railways of Portugal that adds and additional start card with disks for each player. Good delivered to Lisboa are placed on each player's disk. The first player to collect 4 cubes receives 3 points.

Name: Railways of Portugal: Port to Porto
Description: This is a small expansion to Railways of Portugal that alters the initial setup. Porto becomes a combined Blue/Purple city.  Additional purple cubes are added at setup.

Name: Railways of Portugal: Hotel Magnate Promo Card
Description: This is an additional goal card for Railways of Portugal. Points are awarded at the end of the game base on the number of hotel cards you have -- and there are a lot more hotel cards in Railways of Portugal than most Railways games. Promo is courtesy of Never Bored Gaming.

Name: Railways of Portugal: Kickstarter Promo Pack
Description:
Included as part of the Kickstarter for the base game. Adds several new types of cards to the event deck.

Contains:
2 x Government Subsidy
1 x State Treasury Shares (start card)
1 x Operations Growth
1 x Boomtown
2 x Express
2 x Civil Engineers

Name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Tear Me A New One Promo Card
Description:
May be used once by a player to immediately steal all Carrots received by an opponent during the current turn. Tear Me A New One may be used at any time but only by the game’s owner (or with the owner’s permission) by tearing the card in half!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ophidian 2360: Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter Promo Pack
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes three new cards (two of them double-sided) for Ophidian 2360

Terror Blast
Xarz'ycus VP7/6 
Xarz'ycus VP5/4

Name: The Banana Tree Game
Description:
Object of the game is to put as many bananas as you can in the monkey's basket without making the monkey fall off the tree.

The game comes in a small plastic suitcase.  You open up the suitcase and then build the tree, attaching it to the middle of the open suitcase.  Then the basket is attached to the monkey and then monkey is attached to the magnet on one of the branches of the tree.

Each player is given three brown bananas, one of each size. 
 The rest of the bananas are placed in center for all players to use.

Players take turn spinning the spinner to determine the type of banana that is added to the basket.  If the monkey and basket fall, the player who knocked it off must take back all the brown bananas, placing the yellow and green ones back in the center pile.

The winner is the first person to be out of brown bananas AND the monkey falls on another players turn.

—user summary

Name: A Feast for Odin: Mini Expansion #2
Description:
The second mini-expansion for A Feast for Odin includes a number of new components and a few new variant rules.

				
				
					New components
     New 1x1 tile types: berries (orange), eggs (red), amber (green), gullgubber (blue)
     New B-exploration board: Isle of Mull
         Obtainable with the 1 viking Exploration action
         Income goes up to 4 silver
         Worth 9vp
         Bonuses: salt meat, ore, wood, goldgubber, egg, stone, altar - the altar is a 6-space (1x4+1x2 middled) special tile only obtainable via this island's bonus and cannot be bought, forged or plundered
    
     (Half-) Island on Backside: Caithness
         Obtainable with the 3 viking Exploration action
         Income goes up to 5 silver
         Worth 24vp
         Bonuses: fur, amber, stone, sword
    


				
				
					New variants
     Randomized harvests: Includes 8 harvest tokens (identical backs; on front, 4x blank, 1x each of 1, 1-2, 1-3 and 1-4).
         Rules: reveal a non-blank harvest token at the beginning of the game to be the first round's harvest, and after each harvest reveal one of the yet-unrevealed tokens to be next round's harvest.
    
     Resource markers: Includes 10 new markers with different front and backside, which add resources to players' harvests each round.
         Rules: each player gets one in a seven-round game and two in a six-round game, chosen during setup in reverse turn order. During the Harvest phase, depending on if there is a harvest or not this round, flip your token and receive the depicted bonus.
    
     Accelerated start variant for a greater, more exciting experience when playing the six round game.
         Rules: when playing the 6-round game, players start with their artisan shed already built and with 3 extra silver in their supply.
    
     A list of occupation cards that it is recommended to remove: 8 cards that are banned for being overly strong, and 30 additional cards that are recommended to remove in order to bring about a better average of more useful, not such specialized interesting cards.

Name: Ruins Restorer
Description:
Ruins Restorer is a solo Print and Play 18 identical cards game (ICG) designed for Button Shy September 2019 challenge.
The goal of the game is to restore as many ancient ruins as possible, before resources run out.
Game consists of 18 identical poker sized cards with different front and back, each divided in two areas - 4 ruins per card. It uses deck building mechanics, and deckbuilding is achieved through manipulation (flipping and turning)of the discard pile. Discard pile also doubles as a timer that triggers end game and scoring.

—description from the designer

Name: Kill the Sushi Master
Description:
Kill the Sushi Master! In this highly addictive, fast-moving card game exclusive to Kickstarter where your goal is to avoid any poorly prepared and under cooked sushi and be the last Itamae standing to win! ! Do whatever it takes to be the best in front of the cutting board! (We’ll explain later, but trust us, in Japan: it’s super cool to be in front of the cutting board.)

At the beginning of your journey, you must collect all the ingredients and accessories to first become the Wakiita. Then you must wield the mighty hocho and defeat all the other aspiring sushi chefs. What? Did you think you were the only one aiming to stand in front of the cutting board? Everyone else is striving to get to that prestigious spot. You could use your remarkable skills to make your way to the top, or you could take the totally normal route of making your way to the top by damaging their reputation by introducing nasty smelly salmon and any other unpleasant ingredients to their food.

—description from the designer

Name: Operation Compass: North Africa, December 1940
Description:
Operation Compass: North Africa, December 1940 is an Operational level Solitaire board-wargame where the player primarily takes on the role of commanding the Allied forces during the first 4 days of the campaign in Egypt that saw the Italian forces forced out of that country in 1940. The Italian forces are managed by the player in accordance with the rules. The game is not designed for two players. Each hex represents 3 miles from side to side. Each turn represents half a day. Unit counters represent battalions, or Regiments/Reinforced Regiments. Playing time, typically less than two hours.

—description from the publisher

Name: SUCK
Description:
You are each a member of a secret society of humans, living inside an underground bunker to hide from the vampires who lurk above. When someone gives you provisions, it makes you more valuable to the group, which matters when the boat finally arrives to whisk your group to safety. But the provisions are tainted with vampire blood....

On their turn, players send provisions to other players from a face-up deck. The cards are public but the undersides of the cards may have bites on them. Each provision has a low, medium, or high probability of being tainted with vampire blood. The players with the most valuable provisions are thus the most dangerous to the group. Subtle negotiation is required to get the most provisions onto the boat without bringing too many vampires.

This semi-sequel to GROWL (2019) keeps the primary "card giving" mechanism but removes player elimination and the honor-system aspect. It also introduces a riveting finale.

—description from the publisher

Name: ¡Misiles, Ahora! Políticas Internacionales
Description:
International Policies is a mini expansion of Missiles, Fire!, which modifies the gaming experience with cards that change the interaction with other players.

Now they can play up to 6 players, making them live the tension of the Cold War in a more intense way. This fight will cause more extensive games, with only the inclusion of 5 new cards and an additional copy of the Missile card.

Note: After the change to the second edition, this expansion became part of the base game, making the whole set a single game and causing it to stop publishing.

—description from the designer

Name: Holmes: Sherlock & Mycroft – Madame Zarina Promo Card
Description:
Promo card created for the German edition release of the game.

It allows you to take three clue cards, choose one and let your opponent choose another one.

Name: Glen More II: Chronicles – promo 3: What Lurks Beneath
Description:
A promotional chronicle included in the Kickstarter edition of the game which adds Nessie, the fabled Loch Ness Monster, to Glen More II: Chronicles.

Nessie is placed on the main rondel and when players pass over her they must draw from a deck of cards and resolve the effect. This can range from trading items for points, gaining resources, reorganising coins in the market and so on.

Name: Search History
Description:
Search History is the only party game that uses real searches in it’s hilarious and unique gameplay.

Read one of three prompts aloud and compete with friends and family to anonymously create the most believable search query.

Take turns guessing what the most commonly searched phrase is and score points if your answer is guessed by others.

Combine with the NSFW Edition for even more fun!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tiny Castle Crush
Description:
Tiny Castle Crush is a game about building your castles and destroying others' castles. It is the series of Castle Crush, however stand alone game.

The game plays 3 rounds. There are 4 phases in each round: Income, Build, Attack and Evaluate phases.

     Income phase: each player takes one block from the supply until running out ot the available blocks.
     Build phase: each player chooses one map tile and build a castle on top of the map tile by using the whole blocks owned. After completing their castle, each player moves the map tile with completed castles to the center of the table in order. Each map tile must connect to the other map tiles with the same landscape. 
     Attack phase: active player may either choose to attack a castle by falling the hammer. The attacker earn the blocks he/she knocks down, or pass the rest of Attack phase.
     Evaluate phase: the castle with the the most blocks earns the big castle reward. The castle which is highest one including the King earns the Tower reward.


After three rounds, the last scoring carries out. The player who earns the most VP is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Boston (fan expansion for Tramways)
Description:
The Boston experiment with public Tramways began with a series of elevated electric rail companies that slowly spread throughout the city and the surrounding suburbs.  An unreliable power grid meant that these companies produced their own power (at 25 Hz) to ensure the availability of their services.  As time passed, the companies began to merge together until they became the modern Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority (MBTA), only moving onto the public 60Hz grid in the 1980’s.

Your role as one of these early companies is to overcome the difficulty of the limiting nature of the power generators in early Boston as you expand your network to move the citizens of Boston to and from the many historic locations in town.  Don’t worry though, the power generators are becoming more efficient every year, and there’s always horse drawn tramways to help get people to their final destination…

—description from the designer

Name: Black Death (fan expansion for Tramways)
Description:
Long have the animals of this world grown and prospered, finding ever more means of sustaining themselves and their kind.  They sprout up anywhere they find favorable conditions, and when the conditions are not, they adapt to make themselves hardy enough to survive.  As they grow in numbers, so too does their insolence.

But not for long.

Now is the time for us to strike!  Now is the time to bring these “humans” to their knees and show them that their safety, their progress, is illusory.  For what they see as a strength, their numbers, will be their undoing.  We shall descend upon them with a fury the likes of which they have never seen.  None shall be spared our retribution, all shall wither under our onslaught, and once again the proper balance shall be restored.

We are Pestilence.

We are Suffering.

We are Black Death.

In Tramways: Black Death, players take on the role of Yersinia Pestis and spread the Bubonic Plague (the Black Death) from the Asian Steppes to all of the Western World.  Points can be achieved through normal means, but also through the spread of the Plague through Europe and the Middle East.  In the end, only one player will win, but the Black Death shall ultimately be victorious.

—description from the designer

Name: シトラスポット (Citrus Spot)
Description:
In ã‚·ãƒˆãƒ©ã‚¹ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ (Citrus Spot), each player takes 4 "orange" slices, 1 "damaged" black orange slice, and 3 "lemon" slices.  Each player also takes 5 bags.  The player puts the 5 oranges slices into the bags, and places them face-down, in an order of their choosing, in front of their opponent.

On their turn, a player either reveals their left-most envelope or uses one of their lemon slices to either shift the order of their own envelopes or their opponents.  The first player to reveal their damaged orange loses.

Name: The Lesion: Charcot's Tournament
Description:
Paris, 1893

You have been summoned to the deathbed of Jean-Martin Charcot, the self-proclaimed godfather of neurology.  At first, you assume he wants to apologize for plagiarizing your paper about the taxonomy of eyelid tremors, but his intentions are much more grandiose and devious.

Charcot has hand-picked you to face off against Europe’s most illustrious scientific minds in a battle of medical dexterity. Your opponents are as powerful as they are socially awkward, master diagnosticians who wield reflex hammers as if they were extensions of their very limbs.  You have always done well on standardized tests, but this will be the greatest challenge of your distinguished career.

With the eyes of world upon you, you will take turns examining patients with symptoms like weakness, numbness, and eye movement abnormalities. Find the source of these problems, and you will emerge triumphant from this Colosseum of neurological ailments.

Will you be the first to master the nervous system, find the most lesions, and become Charcot’s heir-apparent? Only then will you earn the greatest honor in the history of medicine: to have all future neurologic diseases bear your name.

The Lesion: Charcot’s Tournament is a strategy game based on real human neuroanatomy. Players map neurologic electrical pathways that sense the environment and tell our bodies what to do. Earn points by finding lesions where two or more pathways overlap. Earn even more points by finding a lesion in every part of a pathway.

Name: El Respondedor
Description:
The board game in which you have to guess the answers of your friends!

Each turn, there will be a question given by the game, and 2 possible answers. Each player will have a role:

     The Questioner: Will read the question and the 2 possible answers, out loud.
     The Answerer: Will answer the question, choosing his answer card, and putting it face down over the table, without anyone seeing it. He will win victory points for every player that guesses his answer.
     The Guessers: Each Guesser will try to guess the Answerer's answer, by choosing a card, and putting it face down over the table. At the same time, they will have to choose how many victory points to bet. If they answer correctly, they double the points they had bet. If they answer incorrectly, they lose the points.


The goal is to have the most victory points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Memonsters
Description:
Memonsters is a bright and fun game, in which you need to raise your monster. 
Open the tiles one by one and try to make your mentee out of them. 
Whoever manages first - wins!
Each player chooses his mentee and puts a tile with his head in front of him.
The remaining parts of the selected monsters (6 body parts and tails each) are mixed together with special tiles facedown between the players..
In his turn, the player opens 1 tile so that everyone can see it. If this is a part of his monster, he tries to attach it.
Sometimes you need to rotate tile to attach it. Sometimes you can’t attach the tile you need to put it back and take later.
If a player opens a special tile, he immediately plays it's effect, and then puts it away in the box.

Bright children's game with intuitive rules.
Develops spatial thinking, memory, attention, perseverance.
Child-friendly components.
Balanced gameplay, suitable for the youngest.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dive in!
Description:
In the game Dive in! players, as divers, will dive into the underwater world. Each time divers go on a new mission, they must take pictures of different sea creatures. 
Dive in! is not only a fun pastime, the game develops spatial thinking, attention, sharpness of reaction, motor skills, memory, logical thinking and social skills.

Photography of sea creatures is the main feature of the game process. How does it work? 
To photograph animals, place a perforated diver card on the card of the sea creatures. In the windows, you will see the animals that have been photographed. The others managed to hide from the camera lens.

The game process consists of three stages with different rules. You can choose to go through all of them or play one or two of your favorite ones.

—description from the publisher

Name: Friendly Clouds
Description:
Friendly clouds is an active party game for large companies starting 5 player.

There are friendly clouds in the sky. They enjoy having fun together more than anything else in the world. However, the strong wind is constantly trying to disperse them in different directions. The clouds have to hold hands tight to stay together.

The host opens the wind card and places it faceup in the center of the table.
Players with the cloud cards of the same color stretch their arms forward not to be carried away by the wind. All other players should catch as soon as possible the flying away clouds

—description from the publisher

Name: Mini Bac
Description:
Discover words based on the different themes shown by illutrated cards, and the letter indicated. "[The game of "Baccalauréat"] in its special pocket format", according to the front of the box.

The game evolves on a special board where players put their individual marker, at the beginning of the game they put them at the top of it. A round goes like this : the youngest player starts with a new picture drawn randomly. The goal is for player on their turn, to find a word that begins with the letter indicated by his/her marker position. If the player succeeds to find a word, his/her marker is moved to the next position ; if not, it stays in place for the next round. Once everyone played his/her turn, a new round begins with a new picture, and so on.

The first player who reaches the last line of the board represented by stars wins the game.

There is a possibility to make the game harder for advanced players by flipping the cardboard : this will reveal more difficult letters to find a word that begins with.
